evidence: "LeXInt: GPU-accelerated Exponential Integrators package" and "LeXInt: Package for Exponential Integrators employing Leja interpolation" – described as a package implementing numerical solvers (EXPRB, EPIRK).

"The action of the matrix exponential or the \varphi_l(z) functions on a vector is computed... For homogenous linear PDEs, one can obtain the exact solution (in time) by directly computing the matrix exponential..." – core numerical integration for PDEs, directly used to produce scientific results.

The README presents the project as a GitHub codebase with requirements and literature but gives no instructions for installation via package managers or binaries, implying use via cloning/building from the repository.
